title: 112_hr4118
content: The Act titled "Small Business Procurement Improvement Act of 2012" aims to increase small business participation in multiple award contracts. The Small Business Act is amended to include small business concerns in multiple award contracts and make full use of set-aside programs for small businesses. The Small Business Act is amended to include small business concerns in multiple award contracts and utilize set-aside programs for small businesses. An Agency Outreach Program is established to increase small business participation in multiple award contracts by raising awareness, providing education and training on procedures, and assisting with listing on contracts. The Small Business Act is amended to include small business concerns in multiple award contracts and set-aside programs. An Agency Outreach Program is established to increase small business participation by providing education, training, and assistance with listing on contracts. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. Section 3 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 632) is amended to include various types of contracts such as contracts under the Federal Supply Schedule program, multi-agency contracts, and Government-wide acquisition contracts. Additionally, the term 'blanket Purchase Agreement' is defined in the Act. The Small Business Act is amended to include different types of contracts like those under the Federal Supply Schedule program and Government-wide acquisition contracts. The Act also defines terms such as 'blanket Purchase Agreement' and 'basic Ordering Agreement'. SEC. 4 amends the Small Business Act to establish Government-wide goals for task orders and delivery orders placed against contracts awarded to small business concerns. SEC. 5 focuses on improvements to the Small Business Reserve. Section 15(j) of the Small Business Act is amended to increase the monetary threshold from $100,000 to $200,000. It also includes provisions for multiple award contracts, specifying regulations to ensure correct size standards are applied to each task order. The Small Business Act is amended to increase the monetary threshold to $200,000 and includes provisions for multiple award contracts to ensure correct size standards are applied to each task order. The Administrator of the General Services Administration will ensure implementation of the non-manufacturer rule and subcontracting provisions at the task order level, as well as display correct size information for small businesses on electronic ordering systems. SEC. 6. Small Business representation on the Federal Acquisition Regulatory Council is amended to include the Administrator of the Small Business Administration. In cases of an equal vote, the Administrator of the Office of Federal Procurement Policy will have the deciding vote.
